en: Take your umbrella, it might rain
What do you think I said?
Have you been waiting here for a long time?

fa: من یه سری مسائل شخصی دارم

en: Unfortunately, we will not be moving forward with your request

en: Can I possibly take two of those plates from you?
How many times do I have to tell you?
Do not make decisions when you are angry

desc: "I would rather stay at home" and "I would prefer to stay at home" have a similar meaning and both express a preference for staying at home. However, "rather" implies a stronger preference than "prefer to".

en: Is there something wrong with your table?

fa: اگر ناراحت نمیشی, وقتی رسیدی خونه با من تماس بگیر
en: If you don't mind, Call me once you get home

fa: چگونه می توانم با شما در تماس باشم؟
en: How can I get in touch with you?

fa: دیگه چی می تونم بهت بگم؟
en: What else can I tell you?

fa: من اینجا به دنیا آمدم و بزرگ شدم
en: I was born and grew up here
desc: The verb "to be grown up" is not typically used in the passive voice, and it is not clear who or what is doing the growing up. It is more natural to use the active voice and say "I grew up here" to convey the same meaning. Additionally, "born" is not typically used in the present tense.

fa: از کجا میدونی بهش (زن) داری نگاه نمیکنی؟

Thanks for taking care of my son

fa: مجبورم نکن از ماشین پیاده شم
en: Don't make me get out of the car
desc: "Make + object + (to) + verb": In this construction, the word "to" is optional. It can be used after the object if the following verb requires it

fa: پس تا جایی که بتونم کمکت خواهم کرد
en: So I will help you as much as I can
Keep in mind I am short-handed

en: It is good to see you again
What do you think of her?

fa: دارم چاق می شم و من باید کمی وزن کم کنم

fa: حدود دو ساعت طول می کشد
حقیقت رو بگو, من تحملش رو دارم
en: Tell the truth, I can take it
Why don't you take a few days off?
desc:
Both "Why don't you take a few days off" and "Why don't you take some days off" express a similar idea of suggesting someone to take a break from work or other obligations for a certain number of days.

The main difference between the two sentences is the specific number of days being suggested. "A few" implies a small, indefinite number of days, usually between two to four, whereas "some" is more general and can refer to any number of days.

en: I want to take tomorrow off
I am in charge of here

fa: چرا کتت را در نمی آوری
en: Why don't you take your coat off

بیشتر بچه ها شکلات دوست دارند

desc: "Wake up" is about the transition from sleeping to being awake, while "Get up" is about physically leaving the bed or chair to start the day's activities

en: I can write as much as I can read

en: Last year wasn't as cold as this year in Shiraz

fa: کتاب شما هم مثل مال منه
en: Your book is the same as mine

fa: پرواز او (زن) ساعت یک ربع به نه می رسد
en: Her flight arrives at a quarter to nine

fa: من سود زیادی دارم پرداخت می کنم
en: I am paying too much interest
desc:
"I am paying too much interest" suggests that the amount of interest being paid is excessive or unreasonable, and the speaker is dissatisfied with the situation. It implies that the speaker believes they should be paying less interest.

On the other hand, "I am paying so much interest" simply states a fact that the speaker is paying a high amount of interest, without necessarily expressing a strong negative or positive feeling about it. It may indicate that the speaker has noticed the high amount of interest they are paying, but they may not feel strongly about it one way or the other.

fa: پرداخت ماهانه شما چه مقدار است؟
en: How much is your monthly payment?

fa: دقیقاً همان چیزی است که زودتر گفتم

fa: من میتوانم از خودم مراقبت کنم

fa: من نرسیدم تمام مشقهام را انجام بدم بنابراین  باید خیلی زودتر بلندشم
en: I didn't get around to doing all of my homework so I have to get up much earlier
desc: In this case, "homework" is an uncountable noun, so it doesn't have a plural form. Therefore, you should use "homework" instead of "homeworks" when referring to multiple assignments or tasks. The choice between "All my homework" or "All of my homework" often depends on personal preference or the context in which they are used.

fa: گلابی ها را پوست گرفته و نصف کنید

fa: از صبح چندین بار با او (مرد) تماس گرفتم
en: I have called him several times since morning
Didn't you hear what I said?

fa: آیا امشب دیر خانه خواهی بود؟
en: Will you be home late tonight?
Let me show it to you

fa: کسی برای دیدن او به بیمارستان رفته؟
en: Has anyone been to see him in the hospital?

fa: من باید کفش هایم را بپوشم
en: I have to wear my shoes in

fa: کلاهم را از سرم در آوردم
میشه این پیراهن را تست کنم
en: Shall I try this shirt on?

fa: چقدر طول می کشد تا با اتوبوس بروی؟
en: How long does it take to go by bus?
desc: the main difference between the two phrases is that "How long does it take?" is asking about the duration of time, while "How much does it take?" is asking about the amount of resources or materials required.

fa: چه پیراهنی رنگی را می خواهید بخرید؟
en: What color shirt do you want to buy?

fa: من سعی می کنم اجازه ندهم مشکلاتم در محل کار به زندگی خصوصیم منتقل بشه
en: I try not to let my problems at work carry over into my private life

fa: من قصد دارم پرش بانجی را امتحان کنم، اما می ترسم
en: I am going to try bungee jumping, but I get cold feet

fa: یک نامه با یک تمبر به ایران چند است؟
en: How much is a letter with a stamp to Iran?

fa: چند دقیقه دیگه دوباره امتحان کن
en: Try again in a few minutes

fa: یه چند دفعه امتحان کردم اما شماره هنوز اشغاله
en: I tried a few times but the number is still busy

fa: من یه عالمه نامه تا اونجایی که می تونم مینویسم
en: I write a lot of letters as much as I can

fa: جلسمون چه ساعتی شروع می شود؟
en: What time does our meeting start?

fa: صحبت با کودکان گاهی دشوار است
en: It's sometimes difficult to talk to children

fa: میتونی برام روی کاغذ بنویسیش, لطفا؟
en: Can you write it down for me on paper, please?
I called him but he didn't pick up

fa: این بهترین فیلمیه که تا به حال دیدم
en: This is the best movie that I have ever seen
Do you always talk like this?

fa: آیا آنقدر بد به نظر میام؟

en: Time is more valuable than money

fa: این  خانه ای است که من در آن بزرگ شدم
en: This is the house where I grew up in
You are making a big deal out of it

fa: من تو را بیشتر از هر چیزی در دنیا دوست دارم
en: I love you more than anything in the world

fa: مردی پس از 62 بار خودارضایی مرد
en: Man dies after masturbating 62 times straight

fa: همه متقاعد شده بودند، اما من همچنان شک داشتم
en: Everyone else was convinced, but I remained skeptical

fa: بنابراین می خوام یکی از شوخیاش (مرد) را نقل کنم
en: So I wanna quote one of his jokes

fa: میشه توجهتون رو بدید به من؟
چطور جرات داری چنین چیزی را پیشنهاد کنی؟
en: How dare you suggest such a thing?

fa: چطور جرات داری تو زندگی من دخالت کنی؟
en: How dare you interfere in my life?

fa: چطور جرات داری از من سرپیچی کنی؟
چطور جرات داری منو متهم کنی به دروغ؟
en: How dare you accuse me of lying?

fa: ببین این مورچه در مقایسه با دست من چقدر بزرگه
en: Look at how massive this ant is compared to my hand

fa: حتی به این نمی خوام فکر کنم که گاز گرفتن این مورچه چقدر دردناک خواهد بود
en: I am not even gonna think of how painful a bite from this ant would be
Did you just run out of gas?

fa: میخواهم از خودم تشکر کنم که سعی کردم کارهای درست را بیشتر از اشتباه انجام بدم
en: I wanna thank me for trying to do more right than wrong

fa: میخواهم از خودم تشکر کنم که همیشه بخشنده بودم و سعی می کنم بیشتر از چیزی که دریافت میکنم بدم
en: I wanna thank me for always being a giver and trying to give more than I receive

fa: آیا کسی در تصادف آسیب دیده؟
en: Was anybody hurt in the accident?
We are here to help you
Do you know what this means?
Do you know who they are?

fa: امروز تو مدرسه چی یاد گرفتی؟
en: What did you learn in school today?
